page.title: 10Attitudes in Eccleshall
page.content: Eccleshall is a friendly community, although attitudes differ widely. The older inhabitants seem happy to leave things as they are, whereas younger people are aware of the need for better facilities, such as a sports hall or leisure centre, to provide a larger meeting-place. There is a strong community spirit, common to all ages, and the majority are against the impending closure of one of the schools. All agree that shopping fac- ilities are very good and shopkeepers very helpful, though some feel that Eccleshall has somewhat lost its char- acter with the closure of the cattle market and the influx of commuters. Most residents are progressive and positive in their ideas for improving an already very popular small town.
